hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Regime Transition via 20D/50D SMA Death Cross with Volume Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC is in NEUTRAL regime (confidence >55%), a bearish regime transition will occur within 5 trading days if: (1) BTC price crosses below both 20-day and 50-day SMAs on the same day, (2) daily volume exceeds 30-day average by 25%+, and (3) ETH/BTC ratio declines by 2%+ on the same day.
hypothesis_content.rationale: NEUTRAL regimes represent equilibrium states vulnerable to directional breaks. Concurrent breakdown of two key moving averages with elevated volume suggests institutional selling. ETH/BTC weakness confirms broad crypto market deterioration rather than BTC-specific rotation.
entry_conditions: BTC price < 20D SMA AND BTC price < 50D SMA (first occurrence)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 10% price decline from entry OR regime shifts to BEAR (confidence >70%)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC reclaims both 20D and 50D SMAs with volume < 30D avg

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such signals fail to produce BEAR regime within 5 days OR result in BULL transitions >25% of time
